ranked_sentences: Luis Severino's dominant seven-inning start sealed a 4-1 Mets victory.:10
Luis Severino gave up just one run over seven innings in a 4-1 win over the Red Sox.:9
Francisco Lindor beat the throw to Red Sox catcher Connor Wong to score the go-ahead run for the Mets in the third inning.:8
Luis Severino pitched seven crisp innings, allowing only one earned run and striking out five.:7
Phil Maton closed the game in the ninth for his first save of the year.:7
Jarren Duran hit an RBI single to tie the game in the third inning.:7
Francisco Lindor reached base three times, scored a run, and drove in another.:7
Nimmo doubled to center, scoring Lindor.:7
Brandon Nimmo made a nice catch on a ball hit by Rafael Devers with runners on base, ending the sixth inning.:6
Danny Young got Rafael Devers to ground out to end the eighth inning with runners on second and third.:6
Ceddanne Rafaela hit a triple off New York starter Luis Severino.:6
Duran singled to right, scoring Rafaela.:6
Lindor singled to right, scoring Torrens.:6
Francisco Lindor delivered an RBI single in the fourth inning.:6
Francisco Lindor sparked New York’s lineup again with a key performance.:5
Marte grounded into a double play, allowing Iglesias to score.:5
Torrens doubled to left, and Stewart scored on a fielding error by left fielder O'Neill.:5
Brandon Nimmo's aggressive play led to a triple by Rafaela.:5
Luis Torrens hit a ball that led to a scoring error by Tyler O'Neill.:5
